intro: Senecio barckhausiifolius, commonly known as the Barckhaus's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and sometimes hairy, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
